attributes.action: help my great nanna of 95 be able to live her last years' at her home ..
attributes.additional_details: this is family home where she was raised and other generation's including myself her great grand daughter  I'm 26 and have never seen such a disgrace to this community this is appalling behaviour from the UDC they would rather spend out more to downsize her then help her live her final years in her home and be more mobile please sign this petition to help my great nana get the help she is entitled to she has never asked for any help or been in arrears' with nothing in her life help my nanna....
attributes.background: my great nanna of 95yrs is made to be a prisoner in her own home she has asked for help to be able to help her live her last years in her home all she had asked was smaller steps or a wheelchair ramp and this has been declined they would rather move her and disrupt my 95 great grandmother

rejection.details:
Your local council is responsible for providing aids and adaptations to help elderly people to keep on living in their own homes as they get older, so this isn't something that the UK Government or Parliament could help you with. 

You could try contacting your local councillor for advice about what to do next.  You can find out who your councillor is here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors. Your local MP might also be able to help you, and you can find them here: http://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/ 

You can find more information here about applying for grants to help with home adaptations if your great grandmother is registered disabled: https://www.disabilityrightsuk.org/housing-grants
